intro: Chionanthus porcatus, commonly known as the porcine chincherinchee, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 6 feet, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
